sentence: The rioters overturned several cars and set them alight.
sentence_gap: The rioters overturned several cars and set them ______.

explanation: the distant past, especially before the sixth century
sentence: Cannabis has been used for medicinal purposes since antiquity.
sentence_gap: Cannabis has been used for medicinal purposes since _________.

explanation: (of eyes) small, round, and bright; watching everything closely or with suspicion
sentence: I could just see the bird's open beak and small beady eyes.
sentence_gap: I could just see the bird's open beak and small _____ eyes.

explanation: the amount of space or distance that is needed between two objects so that they do not touch each other
sentence: There is not much clearance for vehicles passing under this bridge.
sentence_gap: There is not much _________ for vehicles passing under this bridge.

explanation: formal; to bring together a group of people for a meeting, or to meet for a meeting
sentence: The council will be convening on the morning of the 25th.
sentence_gap: The council will be _________ on the morning of the 25th.

explanation: the skill or act of saying or discovering what will happen in the future
sentence: Cardano had little patience for the prevailing divination methods of the day, like astrology.
sentence_gap: Cardano had little patience for the prevailing __________ methods of the day, like astrology.

sentence: The song was banned on the grounds that it might foment racial tension.
sentence_gap: The song was banned on the grounds that it might ______ racial tension.

explanation: a short period of time being involved in an activity that is different from and outside the range of a usual set of activities
sentence: She made a brief foray into acting before becoming a teacher.
sentence_gap: She made a brief _____ into acting before becoming a teacher.

explanation: (of a road, an area, etc.) impossible to travel on or through, especially because it is in bad condition or it has been blocked by something
sentence: The mountain roads are totally impassable to cars in winter.
sentence_gap: The mountain roads are totally __________ to cars in winter.

explanation: either of the pair of organs in a woman's body that produce eggs, or the part of any female animal or plant that produces eggs or seeds
sentence: Only the left ovary becomes functional, with rare individual exceptions.
sentence_gap: Only the left _____ becomes functional, with rare individual exceptions.

explanation: formal; to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in
sentence: He opened a newspaper and began to peruse the personal ads.
sentence_gap: He opened a newspaper and began to ______ the personal ads.

sentence: We're going to plough the top field next week.
sentence_gap: We're going to ______ the top field next week.

explanation: informal; to store or hide something, especially a large amount
sentence: The stolen pictures were stashed (away) in a warehouse.
sentence_gap: The stolen pictures were _______ (away) in a warehouse.

explanation: to feel a lot of pleasure, love, etc. because of something or someone
to spoil something or give it an unpleasant quality
sentence: His reputation was permanently tainted by the financial scandal.
sentence_gap: His reputation was permanently _______ by the financial scandal.
